Anyone know a method to measure CPU spee: Do you mean check what cpu speed your running at? ("cat /proc/cpuinfo")
That command will tell you what it is running at.  If its overclocked it will show it.
the cpuinfo is continually being updated, don't think of it as a file, but as a query to your cpu
if you just run something cpu intensive, you can see it going up and down
it is updating dynamic on mine
works out of the box for me
dynamic cpu has to be supported by you computer tho
Maybe it only does dynamic frequency scaling on laptops??
hmm, I see,  Well, cpuinfo doesn't lie.  For example on my lappy, when I;m just chatting away here, cpuinfo says 800mhz
when I start zipping a file or somthing, it jumps up to 1.8ghz
/proc is a dynamic filesystem the represents current hardware/software/kernel settings, so cpuinfo gets updated because /proc is part of the kernel
its like asking the kernel what its doing now, but its represented in a filesystem
thats just the scaling factors that my cpu supports.
you can still see the current bogomips in /proc/cpuinfo |grep bogomips
